Bacterial Leaf Blight.description: Caused by Xanthomonas oryzae. Yellow to white lesions along leaf veins.
treatment: Drain fields and avoid excessive nitrogen
Remove and destroy infected plant debris

Brown Spot.description: Fungal disease causing oval brown spots with gray centers on leaves.
treatment: Apply fungicides like Mancozeb or Carbendazim
Ensure proper seed treatment before planting

Healthy Rice Leaf.description: The leaf is healthy with no signs of disease.
treatment: Monitor regularly for early disease detection

Leaf Blast.description: Caused by Magnaporthe oryzae. Diamond-shaped lesions with gray centers.

Leaf scald.description: Fungal disease with zonate lesions starting from leaf tips.
treatment: Apply fungicides at early infection stage

Narrow Brown Leaf Spot.description: Linear brown lesions on leaves caused by Cercospora oryzae.

Rice Hispa.description: Insect pest causing white streaks by scraping leaf surface.
treatment: Remove grassy weeds from field borders
Use light traps to monitor adult population
Clip and destroy affected leaf tips

Sheath Blight.description: Fungal disease with irregular grayish-green lesions on sheaths.
treatment: Remove sclerotia from field after harvest
